content.description:
Start sitting, and work your way up the right leaning arete on thin crimps, with technical footwork.  A good climb, although the crimps are sharp (hence the name), and it's an eliminate.   

  If you use the huge jug rail twenty centimeters back from the holds on this line, it goes at v0a (for awkward).
content.location: Not strictly on the Loaf Boulder.  Find the Loaf, and head back towards the ranch houses.  Duck down a trail on your right, and head left instead of right.  Right takes you to Numerical Methods.

content.description: Start on the left side of the wall on the arete. Traverse on good crimps and top out once the corridor opens up on the right side. There are jugs for the top out, but be careful not to yank on any of the loose rocks up there. Great movement! This thing needs more attention.
content.location: This route is on the face opposite of Dark Elf. A fantastic warmup for the area. The top has been cleaned, and it seems to be getting some more traffic since the guidebook was written.

content.description: A simple problem with two powerful moves, and a topout that requires thought.  Start matched on the undercling, and move up the arete to finish on the slopers and topout above. Not as well regarded as, say Kung Fu, but the moves are awesome, and more powerful than any single move on Kung Fu.
content.protection: Two pads and a spotter is best.
content.location: Not strictly on the Loaf boulder.  Find the Loaf boulder, then backtrack towards the ranch houses, and cut right down a steep trail.  Sticking to the right on your way down brings you to Numerical Methods.  Sticking to the left brings you to Razor's Edge.

content.description: Climb the obvious crimp rail, commit to the lip, and top out. 5 stars, hands down. One of the proudest out there.

Perhaps the best line in Horseshoe Canyon Ranch, Glass Bowl starts sitting and climbs through perfect sandstone edges to a dynamic move to a perfectly sculpted crimp hold.  Follow through more edges, a mono, a sloper and either a dyno to the jug or a hard to hold swing.  Be careful on that mono!
content.location: This is the only line on the Glass Bowl Boulder.  (Directly behind Grand Dragon).

content.description: Good warm up. Sit start the arete to the right of Glass Bowl, topping out at the end of Glass Bowl.
content.location: It is the right arete on the Glass Bowl boulder.
When looking at Glass Bowl, this route is down the covered corridor to the left. When looking into the corridor from Glass Bowl, the arete is at the very end of the rightmost wall.

content.description: Lots of shade especially after 3 o'clock.
